sect1.title: Shear Tool
sect1.para: The Shear Tool is used to shear layers.

listitem.para: The available tool options for the Shear Tool can be accessed by double clicking the Shear Tool icon.

The Transform Direction sets which way or direction a layer is sheared. The Traditional mode will shear the layer as one might expect. If a layer is sheared 10 pixels to the right, then the layer will be rendered as such. This behaviour is contrary to Corrective shearing.

Corrective Shearing is primarily used to repair scanned images that are not straight. If the image is sheared by 10 pixels then you need not try to shear by that amount. By using Corrective Shearing you can shear visually and line up the layer with the image. Because the transformation is reversed, or performed backwards, the image will be sheared with sufficient angle to correct the error.
The Interpolation drop-down list allows you to choose the quality of the transformation. For more information about the different methods that can be employed, see the glossary entry Interpolation.
This option will clip the rotated layer to the original layer size.
The three available grid options are used to change the visual display of the shearing grid.
Don't Show Grid will display only the outline of the shearing rectangle.
Number of Grid Lines will allow control over the total number of displayed grid lines. Use the Density slider to set the number of grid lines.
Grid Line Spacing allows control over the distance between the grid lines. Use the Density slider to set the distance.

The
Shift s
key combo will change the active tool to Shear.
